item.title: G7: Joe Biden is breath of fresh air, says Boris Johnson
item.description: The PM also says he is in harmony with the US president over NI, as they meet for the first time.

item.title: UK to donate more than 100m surplus vaccine doses, says PM
item.description: Boris Johnson says the donations to countries in need will begin within weeks.

item.title: Ethiopia's Tigray crisis: UN aid chief says there is famine
item.description: More than 350,000 people are living in "severe crisis" after months of conflict in the Tigray region.

item.title: Motor neurone disease: Intense exercise increases risk, say scientists
item.description: Regular and strenuous exercise can increase the risk of MND in people who are vulnerable, scientists say.

item.title: Brewdog boss vows to learn after 'toxic culture' criticism
item.description: James Watt tells the BBC he will use "culture of fear" criticism to become a better boss of the beer company.

item.title: China has created a dystopian hellscape in Xinjiang, Amnesty report says
item.description: In a new report, Amnesty International says China is committing crimes against humanity in Xinjiang.

item.title: Backlash against 'frightening' tests on whales
item.description: An international group of scientists has called on Norway to halt plans for acoustic experiments on minke whales.

item.title: Fashion labels falling short on use of recycled materials - report
item.description: Boohoo, Missguided and Asos named in critical report on the use of polyester, acrylic, nylon in clothing.

item.title: 'You have to fight for the people you love'
item.description: A woman who fought off a crocodile attacking her twin sister tells the BBC about their ordeal.

item.title: OnlyFans: ‘More needs to be done’ to protect children
item.description: The Children's Commissioner for England says she is "shocked" by the findings of a BBC investigation.

item.title: Deepcut: Fifth Army recruit died at barracks
item.description: Private Anthony Bartlett was found dead after a suspected overdose in July 2001, it has emerged.

item.title: A40 crash: Family died when car swerved head-on into lorry
item.description: A coroner hears fatigue or distraction may have caused Zoe Powell to swerve the family's car.

item.title: The Papers: Johnson and Biden's 'love-in' and PM mulls 21 June delay
item.description: Johnson and Biden's first meeting and a possible delay to ending England lockdown are in the papers.

item.title: The mystery of the UK's missing workers
item.description: Why are many firms reporting staff shortages when so many people are still unemployed?

item.title: What is Trooping the Colour?
item.description: Garrison Sergeant Major Andrew Stokes, who is overseeing the delivery of the parade, explains how it works.

item.title: Quiz of the week: What's royal baby Lilibet's effect on succession?
item.description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

item.title: Taller or shorter with Peter Crouch
item.description: Peter Crouch joins Newsbeat presenter Ben Mundy for a game of Taller or shorter.

item.title: Crowded House's Neil Finn: The most debauched we got was water fights
item.description: Neil Finn on touring with Crowded House, playing with Fleetwood Mac and ruining hotel rooms.

item.title: Solar eclipse 2021: Eclipse lights up sky
item.description: Some early risers in the northern hemisphere may have spotted the eclipse in the sky on Thursday morning.

item.title: Covid: Burnley man, 82, returns to lollipop job after surviving virus
item.description: A lollipop man of 22 years returns to work after he became seriously ill with Covid in December.

item.title: Prince Edward congratulates Harry and Meghan on new baby
item.description: The Earl of Wessex spoke exclusively to the BBC on what would have been his father's 100th birthday.

item.title: My beautician saved my life from deadly skin cancer
item.description: Seonag was unaware she had a "mark" on the back of her thigh when she went for a Mother's Day massage.

item.title: G7: What it's all about in 60 seconds
item.description: Jon Kay tells us what is happening ahead of this weekend's G7 summit in just one minute.

item.title: Hitman's Wife's Bodyguard: Film sequel slated by critics
item.description: The movie sequel sees Samuel L Jackson, Salma Hayek and Ryan Reynolds reprise their roles.

item.title: 'Huntington's disease won't stop me having a baby'
item.description: Heather and her husband are going to have a baby, even though Heather's time with the child will be limited.

item.title: Fact-checking Matt Hancock's Covid claims
item.description: We go over the evidence given by the health secretary on the government's pandemic response.

item.title: Ethiopia's Tigray crisis: Tragedy of the man-made famine
item.description: Aid workers are still unable to reach large parts of Ethiopia’s Tigray region because of the war there.

item.title: Why it's the end of the road for petrol stations
item.description: Many petrol stations will close over the next 20 years, accelerating the shift to electric cars.

item.title: Why some say this Nevada town siren is a racist relic
item.description: The siren has been called a "piece of historical trauma" over its disputed link to sundown towns.

item.title: E3 2021: What to expect at the world's most influential gaming event
item.description: Newsbeat's gaming reporter Steffan Powell looks ahead at this year's E3 gaming convention.

item.title: Essex and London accents deemed less intelligent, researchers find
item.description: People with London and Essex accents downgrade others with London and Essex accents, a study finds.

item.title: 'Summit security feels like another lockdown'
item.description: The G7 summit is being held in a remote part of Cornwall, and has divided opinion amongst locals.

item.title: Unique Euro 2020 set to begin - all you need to know
item.description: Euro 2020 gets under way this Friday - and what was already going to be a unique tournament will be notable for several other reasons too.

item.title: Joe Exotic, human bananas and a confiscated shoe - Edgbaston provides light relief for joyous England fans
item.description: How Edgbaston resembled the world's largest stag do as a joyous 18,000-strong crowd savoured a return to sporting normality.

item.title: Asher-Smith powers to 200m Diamond League victory in Florence
item.description: Dina Asher-Smith wins the 200m in a season's-best time of 22.06 seconds at the Diamond League meeting in Florence.

item.title: Krejcikova reaches French Open final with dramatic win
item.description: Czech Barbora Krejcikova shows incredible spirit to beat Maria Sakkari in a classic French Open semi-final and reach her first Grand Slam final.

item.title: Man Utd have £67m Sancho bid rejected by Dortmund
item.description: Manchester United have a £67m bid for England winger Jadon Sancho turned down by Borussia Dortmund.

item.title: France to struggle & Foden to shine? - BBC pundits make Euro 2020 predictions
item.description: Who will win, and how will England, Scotland and Wales do? BBC pundits predict what will happen at Euro 2020

item.title: What next for Rodgers and Green Bay - could NFL's MVP sacrifice $35m?
item.description: With Aaron Rodgers and the Green Bay Packers at a stand-off, could the NFL's reigning MVP really sit out the 2021 season and sacrifice more than $35m?

item.title: How did Bolton deal with the Delta variant?
item.description: Bolton had been "ground zero" for the new variant, but now cases have started to fall.

item.title: Euro 2020 and Covid: How can I watch with my friends?
item.description: Covid rules are making things a bit different for Euro 2020 spectators.

item.title: Covid: What's the roadmap for lifting lockdown?
item.description: The government is yet to decide whether to lift the remaining restrictions on 21 June

item.title: Lockdown easing: Four numbers to look for ahead of the 21 June decision
item.description: The key numbers that offer clues as to whether "freedom day" will proceed as planned on 21 June.

item.title: Covid vaccine: How many people in the UK have been vaccinated so far?
item.description: The logistics of vaccinating millions of people across the country, as almost 41 million people receive at least one dose.

item.title: When could social distancing end?
item.description: Will we still need to be socially distanced through the summer? A social distancing review is advising the government.

item.title: Covid: When will I get the vaccine?
item.description: The vaccine is being offered to over-18s in Wales and Northern Ireland, over-25s in England and over-30s in Scotland.

item.title: Covid: How should I protect myself from Covid now?
item.description: What are the actions we can take to reduce our risk of catching the virus?

item.title: Covax: How many Covid vaccines have the US and the other G7 countries pledged?
item.description: The US is set to confirm it will give 500m doses of the Pfizer vaccine to the international Covax scheme.

item.title: UK holidays: When and where can I go... and who with?
item.description: Going abroad is not straightforward, so many people are opting to stay in the UK for their holidays.

item.title: Covid: What do we know about global youth unemployment?
item.description: Young people have suffered from the economic consequences of Covid.

item.title: Covid: How is Europe lifting lockdown restrictions?
item.description: A third Covid wave hit much of Europe hard but now gradually lockdowns are being eased.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Covid: What do under-30s need to know about the vaccine?
item.description: The vaccine rollout is now reaching younger adults. What do they need to know about getting jabbed?

item.title: Covid: Which areas are being surge tested for variants?
item.description: People who live, work or travel in various parts of the UK are being urged to get a Covid test.

item.title: What are the rules for travelling to green, amber and red list countries?
item.description: Foreign holidays are possible, but travellers must follow strict rules on their return.

item.title: Travel guide to Spain, Portugal, France and more holiday hotspots
item.description: What you need to know about travelling abroad to Portugal, Spain, Greece, France, Italy and Turkey.

item.title: Covid Indian variant: Where is it, how does it spread and is it more infectious?
item.description: The Indian variant is spreading in some parts of the country - how serious is it?

item.title: Covid-19: Could a third wave change 21 June plans in England?
item.description: Rising coronavirus cases have called the planned 21 June relaxing of rules in England into question.

item.title: Lockdown muscle loss: Five ways to get back in shape
item.description: Lockdown inactivity may have left people with weaker muscles - there are simple solutions.

item.title: Lockdown rules: What are the restrictions in your area?
item.description: Use our search tool to find out about coronavirus rules and restrictions where you live.

item.title: Myanmar: The mysterious deaths of the NLD party officials
item.description: The deaths of officials from Aung San Suu Kyi's party has raised scrutiny of the military's actions.

item.title: Freddie Figgers: The millionaire tech inventor who was 'thrown away' as a baby
item.description: Entrepreneur Freddie Figgers says life has taught him that the important thing is people, not profits.

item.title: Valentina Petrillo: 'Better to be a slow happy woman than a fast unhappy man'
item.description: If Valentina Petrillo is selected for Italy's squad in Tokyo this year, she will be the first trans woman Paralympian.

item.title: The Motherload: How pandemic anger almost destroyed a mums' support group
item.description: Abusive messages from angry mums during lockdown almost caused the founder of The Motherload to close it down.

item.title: The children selling explicit videos on OnlyFans
item.description: British subscription site OnlyFans is failing to prevent underage users from selling and appearing in explicit videos, a BBC investigation has found.
